 To run the pre-commit checks locally, you can follow below steps: 1. Ensure that default python is python3. In sonic-mgmt docker container, default python is python2. You can run the check by activating the python3 virtual environment in sonic-mgmt docker container or outside of sonic-mgmt docker container. 2. Ensure that the `pre-commit` package is installed: ``` sudo pip install pre-commit ``` 3. Go to repository root folder 4. Install the pre-commit hooks: ``` pre-commit install ``` 5. Use pre-commit to check staged file: ``` pre-commit ``` 6. Alternatively, you can check committed files using: ``` pre-commit run --from-ref --to-ref ```

> Please also confirm if this script can be added into PR test.

Sure, will verify the case on kvm and add it into PR test if no issue, thanks for reminder.
hi @lipxu could you check the conflict?

> hi @lipxu could you check the conflict?

Merged to the latest master and fixed the conflict, thanks for reminder.

> > Please also confirm if this script can be added into PR test.
> 
> Sure, will verify the case on kvm and add it into PR test if no issue, thanks for reminder.

@yutongzhang-microsoft has add the new case into PR test, please review again, thanks a lot.

Sorry, I forgot to paste. Done

Could you please help to merge it?@wangxin
Hi @bpar9 could you please review the changes?
Manually tested with 202311 branch. Confirm the PR can fix the issue.
@yxieca @bingwang-ms Can you please help add approval tag for 202311 and 202405 branch? Thanks!

> Hi, @lipxu, have you tested this script on kvm testbed? If this script can run on kvm, please add it into corresponding PR checker.

Not yet, but the script includes a warm-reboot operation, not sure whether it is supported on kvm.
Could you suggest a quick way to verify it? thanks a lot

> ncludes a warm-reboot operation, not sure whethe

Hi, @lipxu , can you test locally first? And then, you can add this script into onboarding T0 and T1 PR checker https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/blob/master/.azure-pipelines/pr_test_scripts.yaml#L343

> > ncludes a warm-reboot operation, not sure whethe
> 
> Hi, @lipxu , can you test locally first? And then, you can add this script into onboarding T0 and T1 PR checker https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/blob/master/.azure-pipelines/pr_test_scripts.yaml#L343

This case includes fanout interface operation (shutdown/no shutdown), and warm-reboot which not supported on kvm yet. will skip it on kvm.

> > ncludes a warm-reboot operation, not sure whethe
> 
> Hi, @lipxu , can you test locally first? And then, you can add this script into onboarding T0 and T1 PR checker https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/blob/master/.azure-pipelines/pr_test_scripts.yaml#L343

Hi, @yutongzhang-microsoft added the test case into the PR test list.

Hi @lolyu could you please help to review this PR?
Hi @wangxin could you please help to merge this PR?
Hi @yxieca @bingwang-ms could you please help to approve the backport request?
@yxieca Can you please help merge this backport PR? Thanks!
Maybe this file is not used anymore. But should this PR go back to 2024 or 2023 branch? Or master branch only?

> Maybe this file is not used anymore. But should this PR go back to 2024 or 2023 branch? Or master branch only?

@wsycqyz thank you for confirming. I noticed the same. I have created an issue #14010 which has other test scripts which I thought were deprecated.
Do we need this PR in 2023 or 2024 branch?

> Do we need this PR in 2023 or 2024 branch?

Yes, PR is applicable to both 2023[05|11] and 202405 branches (as indicated in `Back port request` section).
hi @lolyu @yaqiangz would you help to take a look?
Hi @StormLiangMS, can you please help this to merge? Thanks!

Hi, @vkjammala-arista, I found that my PR #14042 is dup with yours
cloud I merge my PR and close yours?

> Hi, @vkjammala-arista, I found that my PR #14042 is dup with yours cloud I merge my PR and close yours?

Hi @w1nda, just had a quick look at your changes and I think we are not covering all cases there (left review comments), you can address those or we can go ahead and merge my PR.

> > Hi, @vkjammala-arista, I found that my PR #14042 is dup with yours cloud I merge my PR and close yours?
> 
> Hi @w1nda, just had a quick look at your changes and I think we are not covering all cases there (left review comments), you can address those or we can go ahead and merge my PR.

Thank you for reviewing.
 We are good to merge your PR.
 I tested this PR with m0 and mx topo, and it passed.
@bingwang-ms @yxieca Can you please help add approval tag for backport? Thanks!

Hi @wangxin could you please help to merge this PR?
Hi @yxieca @bingwang-ms could you please help to approve the backport request?

> As this solution is to workaround the fanout which is not using the mellanox switch, suggest only apply this solution when the fanout is not mellanox switch(onxy or sonic)

Added a skip statement for Mellanox leaf fanout.

https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/pull/13326 only fixed test_ipinip_hash_negative.
@justin-wong-ce 
BTW, could we fix the print line and ensure it's compatible for both py2 and py3? Then when other case tries to load ptf script, it will not encounter this failure again.

" File \"ptftests/py3/pfc_wd_background_traffic.py\", line 40"
" print(f\"traffic from {src_port} to {dst_port}: {queue} \")"

> #13326 only fixed test_ipinip_hash_negative. @justin-wong-ce BTW, could we fix the print line and ensure it's compatible for both py2 and py3? Then when other case tries to load ptf script, it will not encounter this failure again.
> 
> " File "ptftests/py3/pfc_wd_background_traffic.py", line 40" " print(f"traffic from {src_port} to {dst_port}: {queue} ")"

Sure I will make another PR for that
@StormLiangMS could you please help merge this PR?

@yutongzhang-microsoft we may need to run a test to verify this tolerance. Another option is to run the test to finish to calc the conflict rate, if it beyond the limit, we can fail the test, but with some data about the conflict rate.

> @yutongzhang-microsoft we may need to run a test to verify this tolerance. Another option is to run the test to finish to calc the conflict rate, if it beyond the limit, we can fail the test, but with some data about the conflict rate.

@StormLiangMS As we talked offline, I add some debug message to get the route number we expected and the route number really added.

> LGTM.
> 
> Few lines above at 141 I see validate_url_or_abort. I think logging url information in that function will help with catching malformed URLs.

Good suggestion! Added a log to `validate_url_or_abort`.

Hi @XuChen-MSFT 
Thanks for the attention to detail, yes that's a good idea to add in.
Added!
Also went ahead and inserted the "gr2" asic supported list for test_qos_sai since it'd be nice to knock off that setup file too in this PR.
Is it possible that the PR affects other vendor SKU?
@vkjammala-arista please check if the fix will the failure on other topologies?

> @vkjammala-arista please check if the fix will the failure on other topologies?

Hi @ZhaohuiS, ran the test on other topology (dualtor), where the issue was not there. And the test is passing fine there as well.

> Do you run the test with your fix on t0/t1?

Yeah, we have few runs on t0* topologies (having this fix) and test is passing.
@StormLiangMS Can you please help this to merge?
@rraghav-cisco Thanks for the comment. I have updated the code to avoid duplication. can you help to review it again? Thanks.

> Can we simply ignore the fdb entries from the IPv6 echo replies?

I don't believe there is a simple way to just ignore it.
The echo reply would cause the DUT to learn all the mac addresses used in the test (even the "fake" ones that are generated).
There is also no telltale sign from `show mac` that will indicate that a particular entry is from the echo reply. 

Even if there is a way to differentiate ipv6 echo replied fdb entries, I don't believe it will be a good idea to filter or add logic to check, as the goal of the test is to test the behaviour when the mac address is unknown. The test will be the most accurate and functionally correct if the DUT indeed does not know the mac at all.

> Can we simply ignore the fdb entries from the IPv6 echo replies?

Actually, will change it so that we disable IPv6 on the DUT side instead of disabling it on the PTF container. Disabling on PTF may cause some previously populated items to be lost.

Ensure that the `pre-commit` package is installed: ``` sudo pip install pre-commit ``` 3. Go to repository root folder 4. Install the pre-commit hooks: ``` pre-commit install ``` 5. Use pre-commit to check staged file: ``` pre-commit ``` 6. Alternatively, you can check committed files using: ``` pre-commit run --from-ref --to-ref ```
